description:
In Tokyo's downtown district of Ikebukuro, amidst many strange rumors and warnings of anonymous gangs and dangerous occupants, one urban legend stands out above the rest—the existence of a headless "Black Rider" who is said to be seen driving a jet-black motorcycle through the city streets.

Ryuugamine Mikado has always longed for the excitement of the city life, and an invitation from a childhood friend convinces him to move to Tokyo. Witnessing the Black Rider on his first day in the city, his wishes already seem to have been granted. But as supernatural events begin to occur, ordinary citizens like himself, along with Ikebukuro's most colorful inhabitants, are mixed up in the commotion breaking out in their city.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Dullahan
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a Dullahan, a creature from Irish Folklore with a head that can be detached from its main body.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryohgo_narita)__

_Ryougo Narita_ is a Japanese light novelist and manga writer. He won the Gold Prize in the 9th Dengeki Novel Prize for Baccano!, which was made into an anime television series in 2007. His series Durarara!! was also made into two anime television series, one airing in January 2010 and the second in January 2015.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.
myspace: @naoya_kazuya  ON/OFF duo consists of the Sakamoto (坂本) twins, Naoya (直弥) and Kazuya (和弥). Naoya is older twin brother and Kazuya is younger twin brother.

__Favorite artists:__ Michael Jackson, Kanye West, John Legend, Pharrell Williams / N*E*R*D, etc

[Website](https://yuyamatsushita.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/YOUYA_JETMUSIC) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/youya_jetmusic/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8reCWltURNvxffp-oLGxDQ)

Yuuya Matsushita is a Japanese pop and R&B singer and actor under Japanese Dream Records. He starred in the Kuroshitsuji Musical as Sebastian Michaelis; 2006 Recorded “foolish foolish” under producer Nakamura Jin (THSK, Exile); 2008 Signed with Epic Records Japan

Website Introduction Theatre Brook (シアター・ブルック, Shiatā Burukku) is a Japanese funk rock band that made its début in 1986. They've been signed with record label Epic Records since 1995. They are known for performing the first opening theme for the 2010 Anime Durarara, Uragiri no Yuuyake. Current members Taiji Sato (佐藤タイジ) Taiji Sato, born 26 January 1967 in Tokushima, Japan) – lead vocals, lead guitar He formed the music group "Young Miracle" with Kō Machida in 2002. Takashi Nakaio (中條卓) Takashi Nakaio, born 18 January 1965 in Kanagawa, Japan – bass He is also active in the band "couch". Emerson Kitamura (エマーソン北村) Emerson Kitamura, born 17 May 1962 – keyboards (previous bands: ex- Mute Beat, ex-Jagatara) He works as a session musician with various musicians like Ego-Wrappin', Kazuyoshi Saito, and Leyona. Takashi Numazawa (沼澤尚) Takashi Numazawa, born 26 January 1967 in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan – drums He works as a session musician with various musicians like Yuko Ando, Chage, Miki Furukawa, Ken Hirai, Yōsui Inoue, Hiromi Iwasaki, Toshiki Kadomatsu, Ryuichi Kawamura, Inoran, Tourbillon, Kiyoharu, Leyona, Noriyuki Makihara, Kazufumi Miyazawa (AFROSICK), Mika Nakashima, Maki Ohguro, Tamio Okuda, Taeko Onuki, Ai Otsuka, Ami Ozaki, Quruli, Ringo Sheena, Sing Like Talking, Shikao Suga, Ayano Tsuji, Masayoshi Yamazaki, Akiko Yano, Minako Yoshida, YUI. Because he studied in PIT (Percussion Institute of Technology) in Los Angeles in his youth, he has worked with many American musicians such as Chaka Khan, Bobby Womack, Al McKay, Verdine White, The Emotions, Hiram Bullock, Will Lee, Randy Brecker, Robben Ford, Jeff Berlin. Former members - Akihiro Yoshizawa (吉澤昭広) – sampling, Moog synthesizer - Yasuhiro Yonishi (与西泰博) – turntabling - Mitsuhiro Mishima (三嶋光博) – drums (Sources: wikipedia.org | theatrebrook.com)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡真里子)

Originating from Studio Live. Notable works as a character designer include [Jigoku Shoujo](https://anilist.co/anime/228/), [Ghost Hound](https://anilist.co/anime/2596/) and [Nurarihyon no Mago](https://anilist.co/anime/7592/). Close friends with [Hiroshi Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/101189/), and often designs the characters for the shows which he directs.
An art director and the representative director of Studio Ara.
